subject: Monitor : handle inventory service offline
commitMessage:
Monitor : handle inventory service offline

Using nameHasOwner and nameOwnerChanged D-Bus signals, a callback is
activated when inventory is started.

There are two primary modes for operation: Compatible Interfaces, the
inventory-detection callback will fail, however start() will be called a
second time after EntityManager starts and forces a reload of the proper
config for the machine type. Separately, if no EntityManager exists,
then the callback for Inventory-detection will succeed and use the
default configuration file.

To test: stop fan monitor and inventory services. start monitor, wait
10s, start Inventory, after about 15s you should see the online
detection.

Signed-off-by: Mike Capps <mikepcapps@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I289493a0aabb849abee8ce8de047513e94ee2219

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as b4379a1e8216c64816dcfcc02a4710309478bb9c
This is misleading since nothing here is related to inventory. The subscription you're doing is against interfacesAdded on sensors, not anything in inventory.
Done

Same here, this is looking for when interfaces are removed on sensors.

Why not use the nameHasOwner/nameOwnerChanged combination against the inventory service to know when its been started? Did you find that did not work?
Done
You're using nameHasOwner/nameOwnerChanged now right?
Done
wrapping
Done
What's this for?
Done

With current functionality, there's no reason to do this if the inventory service is running.

If its not running, then subscribe to nameOwnerChanged so the configs can be loaded and fan monitor can start, then could reset the match on the nameOwnerChanged. (This should be done until we're going to handle inventory service crashing at runtime beyond how fan monitor handles it currently)
Done
Is this the only reason to have that `fromSigHup` bool? IMHO, I dont find this worth the extra parameter.
Done
Doesnt look to be used, so why add?
Done
Wont need this if the match is reset after seeing inventory has started so fan monitor can load/run.
Done

It would be better to keep the owned state of the inventory service with the nameOwnerChanged signals, so maybe we dont reset that match? and instead fixup how to check whether to `load()` or not by looking at if we already have objects created or not.
Ack - for later offline discussion
Its no longer an interface match when using nameOwnerChanged signals.
Done

Dont believe we want to log this since we'll hit this path after the inventory service dependency is removed from the fan monitor service. I found this after cherry-picking this change on top of another service file spot check test I was trying.

When handling down the SIGHUP path, if no config is found there would have been a configuration loaded originally before the receiving a SIGHUP so the original config should stay in place.
Done

People restart entity-manager a lot for debug.  If that were to happen now with the match still around, would that result in load() being called again even after fan-control is up?  Maybe you can put a !_loaded check in load() to be sure to only run it once?

I also found this issue in testing and pinged Mike on the side about this as well, which it's correct to remove it here, just that the additional changes (like you noted with using `!_loaded`) are missing and need to be added.
Done

I dont believe there's anything to try/catch here by simply making a match, is there?

I think you can just make the `_inventoryMatch` when the inventory service is not running yet.

You'll want to create _inventoryMatch before the method call on line 61 or there is a (very small) window where the service could be started after that call but before you create the match, meaning you'd never get a callback.

You can then delete it if the inventory is up.
Done
This is never set back to false. I need to further investigate to see if that is ok.

fwiw, I loaded up a quick hack utilizing this variable in System::start() where the config is only loaded if inventory is running and a config has not been loaded yet. Initially it seems only having this set to false when fan monitor starts is the only use-case and after fan monitor loads its config after starting, the only way to reload its config is thru SIGHUP.
Done
could you add inventory in the name somehow since it's just for that service?  invServiceCallback maybe?
Done, I also made it private
Lets remove this since its logged in load() after receiving the SIGHUP
Done
Mostly looking good, just some minor enhancements to make and should be good to go! Thanks Mike
This can just be a local variable here, see comment in sighupHandler().
Done
Done

I think we still want to subscribe to the sensor services here. (This means it can be removed from inventoryOnlineCb() since it'd be done in here if load() is called from that callback function.)

Was there a reason to remove this since it appears we would not subscribe to the sensor services if fan monitor is restarted while inventory is still running?

Done

I think the reasoning was since monitor cannot start without Inventory, it seemed possible to delay connecting the sensors until the inventory prereq was met. There may be a slight timing advantage in setting up the Fan obj's before inventory is ready, resulting in faster bootup so it's probably better to subscribe first.
Without this though, we'd possibly have stale sensor subscriptions after getting a SIGHUP since the config could be different.

For completeness, I feel as though we should explicitly check that `newName` is not empty before we call load() as well. `newName` being empty  would represent the inventory service no longer running. In addition, probably could add a comment stating that this should never happen since we reset the match on the first nameOwnerChanged signal received for the inventory service.

Done

Separately, if we want to keep program image size down, I can make one std::string and use references/recycle the variable. What do you think?
You can if you want since, in this case, we dont care what the oldName was since inventory is up as long as `newName` is not empty.
Remove from here after adding to load().
Done

This would not be guaranteed to still be true whenever fan monitor receives a SIGHUP. There isnt a requirement that inventory being running to accept a SIGHUP to reload fan monitor's config since inventory had to be running for fan monitor to be running to be able to receive the SIGHUP.
Done

We still want to reset `_inventoryMatch` when the inventory service is running, and then check whether we've already loaded our configs or not.

This start() method is called each time an interfacesAdded signal for the Compatible interface is sent, which would recreate the _inventoryMatch, which we'd want to reset if inventory is running.
Done
No need to wrap this since load is only called when its already known that loading the config is allowed. (i.e. want to refresh the sensor subscriptions after a SIGHUP)
Done
